website_summaries.verdict: The LX7 is an excellent advanced compact camera with great photo quality. We highly recommend investing in a better lens cap for a pain-free photography experience.
pros: Controls, dials and buttons all logically placed and easy to access
Very good image quality at low ISO levels
cons: Lens cap design could have evolved so it doesn't obstruct the lens when opening

website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-LX7 has a larger than average image sensor and fast zoom lens, but it's best to keep the ISO set on the low side.
cons: Noisy images at ISO 1600 and up
Control buttons are difficult to read

customer_reviews.title: Amazon and square trade ripped me off.
customer_reviews.text: It was a excellent camera until it stopped working. It will Not power on. I submitted the extended warranty to square trade and they did not respond. Square trade is a ripoff.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best point and shoot camera I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The best point and shoot camera I've ever owned. I'm a big Nikon guy but feel they are lacking in options with this range of camera. It was a toss up between this and the Sony RX100v, but I went this direction due to the articulating screen and a few other minor things. Both cameras are great, but for my use I went with the Lumix LX 10.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Alfano

customer_reviews.title: ... five stars with the understanding that no camera is perfect. But it deserves five stars because it performs ...
customer_reviews.text: I give it five stars with the understanding that no camera is perfect. But it deserves five stars because it performs well within or better than expected. With the F1.4 Leica lens, it works great indoors without a flash and performs extremely well outdoors for landscape shots. It has a lot of features packed into it including 4k video, which I have no interest in. But it does shoot bursts in a way that enables the capture of sharp photos in a fast moving situation. The camera is small enough to fit in my back pocket. I use it as a back up to my Lumix FZ1000, which has the great telephoto lens.
customer_reviews.author: Frank N. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: I always liked lumix but this thing lasted about 6weeks. First the blades in front of the lens got stuck and then the camera died completely. I tried contacting Panasonic because it's under warranty but they said it had to go back to the seller but the Amazon return date had passed so I'm stuck with an expensive piece of junk that doesn't work. I don't know what to do.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Nutter

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera that let's you make up your mind, after taking the shot!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera with more controls than I will probably ever use. I especially like the ability to do multi-focus shots then select the focus I want and save it after taking my photos. I frequently save a number of different focal points. I also use this to avoid taking photos of people with closed eyes. I hold the button for a bit and insure that I have the shot that I need.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Amazing at some things. OK at others. Complicated controls
customer_reviews.text: Menus are quite complicated. The camera is very capable. 4k (UHD) video is beautiful. The ability to manual focus is great, very fast lens, amazing ability to control the shot. Though complicated menus take a long time to master. The weak link is that the video lens range equates to something like 35mm-85mm. Good, not great flexibility. The compact size is disarming to subjects. I reeally wish this camera had an audio-in jack.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch

customer_reviews.title: Auto focus is horrible
customer_reviews.text: This camera is prob a great point and shoot camera however the continuous auto focus in video mode is horrible in fact non useable I should have listened to the review in this one . In a camera like this when video is the primary means of use for say vlogging this is not the best choice ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good camera.
customer_reviews.text: A very good camera with high resolution and excellent picture quality. Bought it mainly for its compact size, moveable LCD and for taking still photos although it has good video capability. Downsides are that it took some time to get used to and the movement direction of the LCD is strictly limited. Like its compact size and unobtrusiveness for street and travel photography for which, for my purposes, it's well suited.
customer_reviews.author: Fellow Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Flash dies and autofocus issues.
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of non professional use , the flash on this camera dies right at the beginning of our Disney Cruise Arrgh !!! , We had a Nikon underwater camera and cellphones as back ups , what a disappointment , also auto focus has big issues while taking videos.
customer_reviews.author: beby

customer_reviews.title: This camera is awesome in every single way
customer_reviews.text: This camera is awesome in every single way! It does everything really well. Hey sony it has touch screen. The only reason I've never bought a rx100 was because of the lack of touch screen. This camera is perfect for what I need! For the dude saying about the material felling like plastic, I don't know if he really understand the diference. Sorry dude, this camera has a nice build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rihass

customer_reviews.title: Cheap mans Leica
customer_reviews.text: Many things to like and dislike on this real live pocket camera. The lens is awesome, I do not care what they say. I use it for that reason. It couldn’t be more slippery to hang on to so I got it a leather case which limits it’s quick pocket ability and kicks up the looks. The pictures are very very good. Do I wish I had bought the Leica, always
customer_reviews.author: Alan R. Jakins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: outperforms all my mirrorless MFT systems. For what it is, it is an excellent value. Glad I had it for the wedding, was the primary and my GX85 became my B camera and my G7 with 20mm 1.7 became my C camera. Image quality, ease of use, and especially the stabilization made it invaluable!
customer_reviews.author: Phill

customer_reviews.title: Good quality point and shoot.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Panasonic LUMIX camera that I have owned. The first one's view screen unexpectedly died last year after five years of faithful service. To be fair, the original camera was subject to all kinds of abuse during multiple bicycle touring trips and just kept on ticking, until it just couldn't perform anymore. The photos are clear, the camera is easy to operate, and I appreciated that it has a Leica lens. For the money, you can't really go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: MidwestMother

customer_reviews.title: An amazing camera. Recommend in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera! Brought this on a trip to Japan. Came back home with over a thousand fantastic photos. Super easy to use for an amateur photographer. The quality is really impressive for such a small camera. See photos for what I mean. Highly recommend for ease of use and quality.
customer_reviews.author: turtlepwer

customer_reviews.title: Flash and low light photography is awesome. It’s amazing pre set setting work wonders for ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp camera - transfers photos over to my iPhone X well. Flash and low light photography is awesome. It’s amazing pre set setting work wonders for beginners. Clear, crisp photos for the Gram and any other social media.
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH BOYD

customer_reviews.title: Not what expected
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this camera. The reviews have this camera way too much attention. I find it heavier than should be for point and shoot. Its sharp metal edges are at times annoying. And I have yet to get any clear shots for Macro purposes. I'm still playing around with it, deciding if it's for me or not. But it dosen't have that, I want to run outside and take pictures feel to it. Slow on shutter as well.
customer_reviews.author: MissMav

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: It took some time to figure out all the gizmos, and I'm still learning. That said, I'm using it to take amazing, high quality pics and vids for my marketing business. This is all you really need unless you are going pro, and i'm sure even the pros would have an appreciation for it.
customer_reviews.author: hoosakitty

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: A very nice quality photo and video camera does not fit in any pocket but the sensor size and raw capability it is ok. The only down side is autofocus tracking in video it is not that fast
customer_reviews.author: Hatem

customer_reviews.title: a great travel/urban camera with a 1" sensor and good
customer_reviews.text: I am liking this very much. a great travel/urban camera with a 1" sensor and good controls
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Constant

customer_reviews.title: If you are willing to put in a little care and work, this is an AMAZING camera.
customer_reviews.text: You can move much further along the photography scale with this camera. It has all the right modes (AV, TV and M), awesome lens, intelligently designed controls, a hot-shoe for off-camera flashes (with a wireless remote), an incredible EVF, composition grid lines, easy-to-buy accessories like a filter tube (to fit a polarizer), etc. etc. Panasonic made the right decision, IMHO, to keep the pixel count small (larger pixels) and provide world class optics with the Leica designed lens. The capabilities reward a photographer with patience and willingness to learn. The camera just feels right.
customer_reviews.author: Jay D

customer_reviews.title: The best camera for a family with fast moving kids!
customer_reviews.text: We had to send back a camera that we purchased before this one. It seemed to have trouble focusing without having nearly motionless subjects. The Panasonic Lumix DMC-LX7K was different, and quite frankly, what we've come to expect from the Lumix line. These cameras are great, and great priced as well. The focus is fast and sharp. The range of light conditions where the camera preforms well is vast. We're very happy with our purchase and will probably stick with the Lumix line from now on (sorry Powershot!)
customer_reviews.author: A. Patceg

customer_reviews.title: The flash broke.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great camera. A lot of people have asked me about it. But the flash died recently. I kept hearing a clicking sound when the flash went off then I smelled something burnt. The flash wouldn’t work after that. I’ve had this camera for three years now.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Great for low light!
customer_reviews.text: I have several earlier compact models that I still use. Just getting used to the new improvements and the larger sensor. Very much like the Sony RX100 but much lighter. The 1.4 lens and 4k are remarkable plus half the price of the Sony, which is a very sturdy camera.
customer_reviews.author: Cleon Phillips

customer_reviews.title: The perfect non-professional camera - and amazing in low light
customer_reviews.text: This camera blew me away. I expected a good pocketable (in a leather jacket anyhow) replacement for my older camera - but there's no comparison. Lightning-fast startup, amazing low-light performance, and really nice pictures. What you give up - Long zoom range What you get - Great zone focusing, stunning low-light performance, really nice pictures. I'm sure you could spend the day comparing this to other cameras - but every professional photographer to whom I've shown it has said the same thing - "I've gotta get one - that's the perfect non-professional camera."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best cameras I've owned in 37 years
customer_reviews.text: This camera's features, flexibility, and quality output were more than I expected. It's easy to use in all modes. It is small and light making it very easy to carry in different ways. (It's not small enough for most pockets, but that fine for my style.) I love the fast f1.4 lens for very good low light shooting. I also love the 24mm wide angle. It doesn't go out very far on the tele side, but that's fine for what I shoot. The sensor is large enough and good enough that I don't do any post processing noise reduction! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde

customer_reviews.title: Amazing close up images
customer_reviews.text: Amazing close up images. I use this in a dental office for intraoral picture taking and it is very effective. Sure beats spending 2-3k on a professional setup. Manual focus is really cool and allows for dimensional photography. Battery seems to last forever. Wish it had wireless transfer ability but the sd card is easy to remove. Long distance zoom is not what this camera is intended for so don't even bother. Get it for portrait shooting and macro close ups!
customer_reviews.author: P. Heemstra

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic LX7 -
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent point and shoot camera with advanced functions. I really liked the way it feels while holding, its not too small or not too big. Excellent lense, very fast , very good for landscape photography. I really liked the 120fps (slow motion) video capability. I recently bought a lense tube , now i am able to add the tele converter lenses and wide angle lenses. only thing i am disappointed is i am not able to get a good skin tones using flash.tried couple of settings but unable to get the correct settings, For the price $289.. this is an excellent camera
customer_reviews.author: Ish

customer_reviews.title: The Panasonic work horse camera
customer_reviews.text: This little camera is a real work horse. For a point and shoot, it provides an amazing amount of flexibility. The best features to my way of thinking is the external aperture settings which can be done quickly and easily. The super fast 1.4 lens speed allows pictures to be taken in very low light situations without having to use a flash. In addition auto focus in macro makes this and ideal camera for real close up photography. Quality photos are a snap with the Leica optics; all in all this is one fine camera.
customer_reviews.author: J.W.Treme

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera, love the touchscreen.
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera, my 3rd LUMIX. Really like the touchscreen. Bought used like new from Amazon Warehouse. No issues. Combined with credits to get it for an outstanding price, around $330. Indeed like new.
customer_reviews.author: EdilR

customer_reviews.title: replaced my Leica D-Lux 5
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan of the Lica/Panny cameras...my Leica was trashed and I wanted a replacement...so I chose the Panasonic LX 7...I see no difference except the money I saved buying the Panasonic...I won't carry the LX7 in my pocket like I did the D-Lux5....too much pocket lint entered the D-Lux 5 camera leading to lots of sensor dust....The JPEGS are great, the lens is great and I've learned to work around the Panasonic version of RAW files......at the price I paid it was a no brainer
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Still works, do not underestimate it for photography, to me, it is an iconic camera!
customer_reviews.author: hasan keskin

customer_reviews.title: Best point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I am using it as my primary now instead of my Lumix G4. It's smaller and the onboard sound is just fine for what I shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Archelaus

customer_reviews.title: DSLR grade glass and features on a pocket camera.
customer_reviews.text: Imagine having a MFT LUMIX 12-35 Lens in your pocket. The zoom isn’t huge but these focal lengths are perfect for landscapes and portraits.
customer_reviews.author: Dave N

customer_reviews.title: Best camera i had
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera, picture are vivid, clear and awesome. Video better than professional Sony video camera.(Camera was 3-4 years old). Setting are easy to use, understand and all you have to do is point and shoot. One of the top rated cameras of last year and the battery hold for a long time i got a day's worth shooting sometimes even 100 photos plus video with no problems. i got a second battery and use them back to back and the camera never failed.
customer_reviews.author: Nordstarx

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck in a small enough package.
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera and it seemed as if it was new when it arrived. It's not a huge sensor so low light compared to an slr obviously isn't even comparable but it does great. The body is a little too thick to really be pocketable though. Images are great in good lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Leica lens delivers excellent image quality
customer_reviews.text: Leica lens delivers excellent image quality. Super fast summilux lens opens to 1.4 allowing for dramatic bokeh. Macro capabilities are excellent and you can get incredible detail. Just overall a superb camera for an excellent price. One of my best purchases ever.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Great little Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. I am an artist and love photography but sometimes find it difficult to bring my SLR places when traveling. I purchased the Lumix as a back up camera. It has exceeded my expectations. The quality of the pictures are wonderful. It also works very well in low lighting. It is easy to use and makes adjustments automatically depending on light etc. It's light weight made it very pleasant for sight seeing making it easy to slip into my purse. While I love my SLR I honestly felt that the Lumix quality was to par with the SLR. Print quality came out great as well. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: I'm loving the pics so far, but I have ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving the pics so far, but I have a lot to learn. I'm mostly a point and shooter. Get the companion manual by Alexander White - essential explanation of vast capabilities. This is not really a point and shoot camera (if you use it this way you're missing out on 99% of the feature).
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Pocket DSLR Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a smaller camera to replace my older DSLR and this fit the bill. Nice size for hiking or day trips that can fit in a small bag or pouch. So far picture quality is outstanding. We will be taking a trip to Yellowstone next week and this will get a full test for sure. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TrailRunR

customer_reviews.title: Great portable camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great carry around camera! It's compact enough to throw in a bag (not pocketable though) and the controls are very intuituve and easy to use. I tend to shoot in A mode so, the aperture ring is perfect for my style. The image quality is excellent and it performs well in low light. Overall, I'm very pleased with this purchase and this is my go to camera when I need a compact set up.
customer_reviews.author: Balen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pocket camera.
customer_reviews.text: Solid controls, features and most importantly picture quality. F1.4! Palm sized. ISO wheel keeps getting bumped accidentally. Edit: Used it for a year of casual shooting, still awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Duckˑ

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Fast and sharp
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Fast and sharp! Extremely and both. Three shortcomings: short tele, which I knew going in; complicated flash mode (never mastered a good fill-flash technique); and, after it got wet in the rain, the command dial would only decrease the shutter speed. I got used to the command dial quirk, working around it with the menu button. I used it heavily for 16 months at a daily paper (where it got rained on), and the fill-flash issue was seldom a problem with the 1.4 aperture, but still.... Luckily, I kept a DSLR with Speedlight handy. I'd buy this handsome camera again in a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Su Do Nim

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I've purchase tons of cameras in the past and I have to say this is by far my favorite camera ever!! You just don't need flash for this camera at all! The pictures are sharp looks like I took from a DSLR camera. I'm so so happy I have finally found a small perfect camera :)
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Stop searching and buy this camera
customer_reviews.text: By far the best point and shoot I have ever owned. I find myself leaving my full frame Nikon DSLRs at home a lot since purchasing this little beauty. Super sharp photos and awesome low light performance. Look no further just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R.

customer_reviews.title: Great performance in a compact package
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Lumix for work on film sets. I needed a camera that could handle low-light situations and take quality photos while still being small enough to fit on my tool belt. This camera fits the bill perfectly. Whether I need to photograph a set for my portfolio, or I'm taking continuity shots from the monitor, it performs perfectly. I also love the battery life, often going a couple of (12) hour days without having to charge up. The shooting speed, size, and range of options make this a great camera for people who need a semi-pro compact or to capture everyday moments. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Prya

customer_reviews.title: A fantasic compact camera.
customer_reviews.text: Their slogan should be "Say goodbye to low-detail, poor-color cell phone photos!" This camera is only slightly bigger than your phone and will capture much more detail. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Like the Leica optics and images, speed of writing and versatility of controls
customer_reviews.text: Best camera yet as a substitute for my DSLR when size and weight matter. The Leica optics are great. Writes to the card almost as fast as an SLR. Great rich images. This is my second one. Bought it as a spare before it gets discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: tox doc

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: We recently took two of these cameras on a trip to Ireland/Scotland. We still love our Nikon DSLR but since we were planning on lost of hiking wanted to decrease our carrying weight. This camera is so lite you forget you have it so it was perfect to take on our hikes. We got some fabulous photos. Would our NIkon have taken better photos? Yes, but for the price and convenience this small point and shoot is a gem!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Best Point and Shoot under $400
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a gem. I primarily use it for videos and quick snapshots. Quality of this camera is awesome. Some nice shots @ F1.4. The aperture ring is a nice addition - easy to set aperture. might be a bit confusing since the lens has variable minimum aperture across the range. Overall - a very good second camera for DSLR users as well as very good camera for people who want to explore the creative side of photography without spending much. Almost forgot - the Macro mode really is good - with shallow DOF @ 1.4 - the macro shots really pop out.
customer_reviews.author: Raghul

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent alternative to my DSLR when I don't want to carry heavy gear with me. f/1.4 is pretty much unheard of on anything but a single-focal length lens that would cost more than this whole camera. Having access to all of the settings is awesome, most non-DSLR cameras force you to shoot in auto. Having a built-in ND filter is useful as well. Image quality is comparable to the Sony RX100 ii, which costs more than twice as much, and was my previous favorite compact camera. The only thing the Sony improves is having a viewfinder in addition to an LCD.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectatoins
customer_reviews.text: I like to take pictures of wildlife footprints. I do not know much about photography but this camera exceeds my expectations, especially in low light conditions. I also like the video capability for photographing insects making tracks. Telephoto is minimal.
customer_reviews.author: sarikarkus

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I really like the quality of the pictures this camera takes. I took it to Europe last summer, and it did very well in high light and low light (museums and cathedrals) situations. I am certainly not an expert, but for running around as a tourist, it worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: Alan D.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and even better value.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. A big step up in physical quality and performance from your basic point and shoots. Much better low light performance than cheaper compacts. Feels well made, like a "real camera," not a toy, and makes a nice backup or pocket camera for owners of DSLRs. Only downsides are it's a little bigger than some others: it's a coat-pocket camera not a pants-pocket camera.
customer_reviews.author: Matt T

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera with outstanding low light quality. My wife and I almost never have to use the flash.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Above & beyond other cameras in its class
customer_reviews.text: Great low-light camera. Small and light enough to take anywhere--I didn't want a bulky SLR. Sharp blur-free pictures even in dim-light. Very sharp view screen just like Apple's Retina display. In my opinion, it beats 1/1.7in CMOS competitors like the bulky G15, S110, P7700 in performance and features. Love the HDR (takes multiple shots for greater dynamic range in the picture.) Good battery life--no complaints. I couldn't afford the leading larger-sensor size Sony RX-100, so this camera is a great compromise. My only peeve is it doesn't have an auto-lens cover. I often forget to remove the lens cap while powering it on.
customer_reviews.author: k.a.

customer_reviews.title: Best small camera I have owned and the best I have seen in this class/price range
customer_reviews.text: This camera is quite amazing. Finally, a small pocket size camera with a moderate zoom range that lets plenty of light in from wide angle to full zoom. This is a great camera for architectural shots as you don't have to use a flash, even in low light and the image quality is excellent with low noise.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. HoagTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: The ease of downloading the photos onto my cell phone is nice too.
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to get used to operating this camera but the quality of photos are just what I was looking for. The ease of downloading the photos onto my cell phone is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Ms  Bulldog

customer_reviews.title: High Burst Photo Rate = Fun! Slow motion video = super soft image falls apart.
customer_reviews.text: The high frame rate / burst photo modes are incredible for capturing fast happening events. I use it my slow motion booth called 7booth that also uses a Sony FS700 for slow motion video. Comparatively - the 120 720p video on this is CRUSHED in terms of quality. It's not sharp, very blah low quality
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after about 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this product, but I’ve only had it for a few months & now when it turn it off & the lens retracts into the camera the film down now close over the glass lens anymore. So the lens is exposed at all times. It can easily get scratched/damaged. Everything else works really well. Just wish it lasted especially for the price
customer_reviews.author: Anissa

customer_reviews.title: A Leica in Panasonic clothing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for the features and the Leica lens. Maybe a little small for my hands but has all the features (maybe more) than the almost identical Leica model costing hundreds more. With the savings buy the electronic view finder that attaches to the hot shoe. (Also hundreds less than the Leica model) Buy an aftermarket instruction book if you want to be able to use all the many, many, features.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This and the LX5 are the best full featured advanced compact cameras out there, even today (5-2016)
customer_reviews.author: Ella Fynoe

customer_reviews.title: This camera has the best fast lens compare to camera costing much more
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It's compact size belies its super ability to take pictures in low light. With this camera I donot use flash anymore. It reminds of the old range finder Leica. It can be best used as a street walk around camera for quick shoots. This is the same camera as Leica dlux 6 but at half the price and at a discounted $300 it is a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Fung

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect camera for vacation travel without the bulk.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is awesome. A wonderful travel companion. 1.4 lens makes indoor shooting a pleasure. At museums no flash is necessary. Coupled with the 24 wide lens for vistas and you have a near perfect travel companion. I carry a pocket clamp/tripod which allows taking slow shutter or self pics. With these two together a no bulk photo solution.
customer_reviews.author: Ricochet

customer_reviews.title: A great compact camera for when you don't want to haul around your DSLR
customer_reviews.text: So far (after a few weeks) I really like this camera. It offers a lot of the similar manual features of a digital SLR camera, but on par in size with compact digitals. I would not recommend this for a casual/novice user, because then you'd not be capitalizing on it's benefits. I haven't had a chance to shoot video with it yet, because for some reason it tells me the grade 10 memory card I have (supposed to be the fastest) won't support it. I haven't invetigated what the issue is there yet, but seems odd to me.
customer_reviews.author: Russ A Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Great thing in a small package
customer_reviews.text: This camera is SO much better than I am. The heart of the camera, the optical lens, is superb. The manual and programmable modes are many and impressive. It is compact but not quite pocketable, unless you are partial to really large cargo pockets. A great camera.
customer_reviews.author: DC Guy

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Got this after being disappointed with the color on a canon powershot. I'd had an earlier leica model, and this one did not disappoint. The color is just fantastic. Even on foggy/cloudy days, exposure is spot on with the automatic setting. Even shooting into the sun I get some good, creative shots, whereas a lesser camera would wash out or have white balance issues.
customer_reviews.author: cruzy42

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic low-light camera with excellent image quality.
customer_reviews.text: Just a great camera with low-light capabilities and excellent image quality. I have the previous LX5 model and love them both. Very well built camera - well worth the money. I am using this camera almost exclusively while my DSLR just sits. It works great as an automatic point-n-shoot camera, but also has all the manual controls one could want.
customer_reviews.author: Herb Linamen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect vacation, carry around camera. Photos are stunning. Wireless connectivity to your phone to transfer pictures works great. Worth every penny. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: LX7
customer_reviews.text: This camera was all that was advertised. My one quibble is the lack of a decent printed manual. The pamphlet they included is, typically for Panasonic, little more than a list of features. And it's cryptic to boot. I got this in advance of a long trip, and a manual would have been helpful as I don't always have access to the complete PDF manual, which is also not as well written as it could be. The camera itself does have a sweet lens and performs as well as any small sensor camera I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camera.  no complaints
customer_reviews.text: great camera. unbelievable photo quality. videos are great. i purchased the auto-lens cap and using this camera became much more fun. i have nothing negative to say about this camera. i have had it now for approx. 4 months with no complaints. the IQ is better than my 2004 canon rebel dlsr. however, i the dslr does deliver better pics for sporting events and the bokeh effect on my dlsr is a bit better when i use my 50mm fixed lens. however, the lx7 is my go to camera.
customer_reviews.author: cincy101

customer_reviews.title: its not easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: It for sure needs the strap or a grip, its not easy to hold. But great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Breea Bringham

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix LX7
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine piece of equipment fit for an amateur or pro. I really do like Panasonic cameras, and have owned the Lumix LX-2 & LX-3. I was quite disappointed when I discovered that my camera was defective, and even more so when I found that Amazon had no more stock. So I had to reorder one from B & H, NYC (at a lower than Amazon price).
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: could they make the book in larger print for us elder folks
customer_reviews.author: cheryl smith

customer_reviews.title: Fast  lens, great fps, better high iso then the LX3 and wider range, great price at times.
customer_reviews.text: Fast lens - f/1.4 to f2.3 I was able to shoot at iso 250 to 500 in the Air and Space museum near Dulles airport. With my SLR's I need 1000-3200. Zoom range is very usable. I shot 5 fps shots during a family ceremony allowing me to capture expressions. HDR mode is mildly usable and there is 3-stop bracketing for better results with HDR PC programs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best compact for Architects
customer_reviews.text: 24mm, f1.4, RAW, Lecia lens, need I say more. The perfect compact for architects, with a very wide lens for constrianed interiors, fast glass for dark interior spaces, RAW to allow a wide range of post processing to increase shadow detail, and crisp detail for printing and electronic documentation. Way less hassle than lugging a DSLR with a superwide lens. Shoots RAW plus JPEG, so you can later decide if you want to keep just the JPEGs, or archive the RAW files to keep as an record or to edit your architectural work.
customer_reviews.author: Beth B

customer_reviews.title: Damaged - Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It is very nice however, I was unhappy to see that right out of the packaging the flash was damaged and the corner of the camera had scratches on it. As though it had been dropped, damaged, then packaged. The flash does not function at all. I did call Amazon support and they were very helpful. I am expecting a replacement in 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Love My LX7
customer_reviews.text: It is an incredible camera that I use almost exclusively. It is superior to my LX3 which still works well and is so much more convenient than my Nikon D5100 DSLR. One thing that I found by chance is that the panorama range can be selected by merely stopping rotating the camera where you want it to end.
customer_reviews.author: ptcmini

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: small compact and easy to carry. Great for travel and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Photoman

customer_reviews.title: Best value for money between the enthusiastic cameras
customer_reviews.text: I had the Canon G12, G15, Canon S110. Value proposition over other cameras is its f/1.4 at wide angle 24mm. I quite like the aperture dial and the camera lightness The image quality and performance is similar to the Canon G series. However, the autofocus is quiet faster in G series and I prefer its ergonomics. For the price, a very good competitor in the advanced compact segment. Actually, LX7 offer the best value for money between the enthusiastic cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Orson Rocha

customer_reviews.title: worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: Let me start with what could be better: Color/White Balance especially under artificial lights. Zoom speed and response. Somewhat Flat Colors from the JPEG Engine. Noise at ISO400 and above. Having said that, this lit tle gem is worth every cent that you spend on it. The Strengths are: Rich feature list. Physical Controls.Expandability with Flash Hot Shoe and OVF/EVF. Killer Video. Great Image Quality. Great set of filters, stackable, in camera. Good in camera Panorama, Hand Held Night Mode, HDR. Can be used by all, from beginer to advanced photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Gurkirpal Singh

customer_reviews.title: Setting Up Camera..
customer_reviews.text: The instructions to set up the camera were confusing even if they were written plainly. I’m disappointed with the camera & will never recommend anyone buy this product from Amazon...
customer_reviews.author: Russell Breunig

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-LX7K
customer_reviews.text: After reading the excellent independent reviews of the LX7 I purchased one and have not been disappointed. It is an excellent camera with a superb f-1.4 lens and a great feature set. Low light performance is great. What more can I say...
customer_reviews.author: Guido

customer_reviews.title: Its all about the Lens. Not Megapixel count.
customer_reviews.text: Very Very fantastic camera. Have other full size sensor SLR's and this easily holds its own. The Leica summicron lens with nano coating and digital filter is second to none. Can you say Value? Knew you could. A++++ Really wide angle as well.
customer_reviews.author: EcoActive

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I have not still used some features, like slow motion and time laps. But the performance, en low light conditions, and easey to access features, make me believe that I found "my" companion for everyday quality snaps. I am a professional photographer (fashion) and I`m having a ball. However... for the manual focus... id prefer a wheel rather than a little swiveling handle. Maybe needs time to adapt to. I would highly recommend it to pros looking for an truly portable high quality camera for snaps.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Angel Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: This camera is amazing
customer_reviews.text: The speed and action of this lens is amazing. I have another Lumix DMC LK5 (?) which is good but not as precise as this one. I still need my larger camera for wide angle shots, but extremely pleased with my purchase. Another great feature is to get the action this provides and have it fit in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Maralyn D. Hill Bates

customer_reviews.title: I really really really like this camera - 4.5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the picture quality is great! The features are great! and the controls are very very good. I don't love the flash. Its 'ok'. And I don't like the low resolution of the Panorama mode. Aside from that, these is a power-pack, high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This LX7 takes such beautiful pictures that it's hard to believe it's a small point and shoot camera. And forget about using the flash at night or indoors, just set the ISO to 200, open up the aperture and shoot away!
customer_reviews.author: Jazzfan2

customer_reviews.title: another excellent Panasonic product super quality Lumix DMC-LX7 digital camera super ...
customer_reviews.text: another excellent Panasonic product super quality Lumix DMC-LX7 digital camera super fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: bruggreen

customer_reviews.title: Fun camera, excellent glass
customer_reviews.text: Fun to mess with great manual mode. Has a touch screen - that's why I chose over Sony. Only drawback for me, but true of all the point and shoots - can't screw on a filter. But a little roll of felt some electrical tape and purchased some 52mm filters I was able to make some nice slide on filters - added a 3.0 and 0.9 ND filters.
customer_reviews.author: dan s

customer_reviews.title: Lumix abd KVF excellent
customer_reviews.text: As advertised: sharp and fast; the EVF works for most days and almost works in bright sun ( and hence better than my otherwise great Canon S95) and is worth the additional price. Camera is small and comes close to my Canon D 40. And of course it is light enough to carry everywhere everyday. The total package...S 95 for smallest, Lumix for versatility and Canon D 40 for the big jobs. Good system Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Kassebaum

customer_reviews.title: Takes fantastic pictures, has an exceptional lens with wide aperture
customer_reviews.text: Takes fantastic pictures, has an exceptional lens with wide aperture, is small enough to carry in pocket. Best compact I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: gunther

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect point and shoot camera.
customer_reviews.text: Could only be better if it had a viewfinder. But this camera is up there with the Leica point and shoot which is nearly three times the cost. High quality, fast lens (f1.4 to f2.3 on a 3x zoom). Very high quality images.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Simple but sophisticated.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very easy-to-use camera -- lightweight, compact and every control function logically laid out. The iA and P (program) features work as expected, and the manual settings are as sophisticated as most DSLR cameras. Anti-shake works very well, making the use of a tripod unnecessary for almost all shootings. The camera is extremely fast for it's type, and the battery life is more than acceptable. Best of all, the picture quality compares well to most DSLR. It would be a significant improvement if there's a built-in view finder, GPS bookmark and wifi capability. But at this price it's more than a satisfactory purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Great P+S Camera
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful point and shoot camera with nice manual settings and very good low-light performance. Would highly recommend, makes a great travel piece.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Hartenfels

customer_reviews.title: We love this camera
customer_reviews.text: We love this camera. It arrived in great shape. A quality camera for the price and takes amazing pictures even in low light.
customer_reviews.author: Lew Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Great photo quality
customer_reviews.text: Great photo quality! Very pleased with this this product. Only wish it had another strap other than the neck strap. I was able to put a wrist strap on the camera that I took off of another camera and like that a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney W.

customer_reviews.title: Great point n shoot
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a fantastic little camera. It will do a lot more if I want to get into it, which I hope to do. Small enough to take on a trip but good enough to keep all of your memories.
customer_reviews.author: gordo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Fun to use. Lots of controls. Love the fast 24 mm wide angle. Great for pictures in darker locations like churches, museums, and restaurants. Like the customization features. Fits in purses or larger pockets. This is a great "go anywhere" camera for everyday and vacation use.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: A very high quality point and shoot. I love the ability to go full manual with a camera I can put into my pocket. Great for travelling light. Went with this vs the Sony because of the great lens, and I have zero regrets.
customer_reviews.author: OGZ

customer_reviews.title: Low light and white Balance unite!
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked this camera when it first came out but thought the price was too high. I'm so glad that I waited because even though the price dropped, the quality from Panasonic is still there. I already knew this was 'the choice' for low light situations. This is the perfect camera for those who hate that 'wash out' look. It's nice to have a flash option but it's even better to do without and just get that natural color look in dim settings. The White Balance options are great! Camera has a dedicated button for that labeled as "WB." Can't beat the price of $299.00 either! I'm already getting my co-workers to look at this deal from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Maja B

product_meta.title: Panasonic LUMIX DMC-LX7K 10.1 MP Digital Camera with 3.8x Optical zoom and 3.0-inch LCD - Black
product_meta.description: Style:LX7Panasonic LUMIX DMC-LX7K 10.1 MP Digital Camera with 7.5x Intelligent zoom and 3.0-inch LCD - Black. What's in the box: Panasonic Lumix DMC-LX7 Digital Camera (Black), Battery Charger, Battery Pack, USB Cable, Shoulder Strap, CD-ROM, Hot Shoe Cover, Lens cap, Lens Cap String, One Year Limited Warranty
feature_bullets: 11 FPS continuous shooting (12 frames max) / 5.5 FPS with continuous AF

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars596 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
